result.execSummary:
All charges against Marcus Alie Smith in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus Alie Smith is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on November 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status hearing on October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:58 PM Defendant Marcus Alie Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones appeared by video for Marcus Alie Smith.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
State does not have its witness. Defense moves to dismiss. Court dismisses the matter without prejudice.
Attorney Russell Jones is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county at a rate of $20.00 per month commencing 10-01-22.
